name: ISO 21500
description: ISO 21500 provides guidance on concepts and processes of project management that are important for, and have impact on, the performance of projects.

principles.title: Structured project management
principles.content: Apply a structured approach to project management by dividing the project into manageable phases and processes.

principles.title: Adaptation to context
principles.content: Tailor project management approaches to suit the project's context, including organizational environment, complexity, and stakeholder requirements.

principles.title: Stakeholder engagement and management
principles.content: Systematically identify, analyze, and engage stakeholders to ensure their needs and expectations are understood and addressed throughout the project.

principles.title: Value-focused delivery
principles.content: Ensure project activities and outcomes deliver value to the organization and stakeholders, aligning with strategic objectives.

principles.title: Systematic quality management
principles.content: Implement quality management processes to ensure project deliverables meet defined requirements and stakeholder expectations.

principles.title: Risk management integration
principles.content: Integrate risk management throughout the project lifecycle to identify, assess, and respond to uncertainties that may impact project objectives.

principles.title: Continuous improvement
principles.content: Apply lessons learned and best practices to improve project management processes and outcomes throughout the project lifecycle.
